Source.Name: clisp
Source.Summary: CLISP is a high-level, general-purpose, object-oriented, dynamic, functional programming language.
Source.Description: CLISP is a Common Lisp implementation by Bruno Haible, then of Karlsruhe University, and Michael Stoll, then of Munich University, both in Germany. It implements the language described in the ANSI Common Lisp standard with many extensions.

Package.Name: clisp

Package.Description: CLISP is a Common Lisp implementation by Bruno Haible, then of Karlsruhe University, and Michael Stoll, then of Munich University, both in Germany. It implements the language described in the ANSI Common Lisp standard with many extensions.
